column1: Tomares is a municipality in Andalusia
column2: southern Spain. It is a Seville suburb of over 25
column3: 000 inhabitants situated two kilometers west of Triana District of Seville
column4: separated from the city by River Guadalquivir. It is surrounded by other municipalities of the Comarca of Aljarafe
column5: whose boundaries are reduced to a single street

column1: In 2016 construction workers uncovered a 600 kg (1
column2: 300 lb) hoard of ancient Roman coins in Zaudin Park. The bronze coins were stored in 19 amphoras while newly minted
column3: and are stamped with inscriptions of emperors Maximian and Constantine. Some were originally coated in silver.
